explains: n. （对政党、宗教、统治者的）忠诚，效忠，拥戴
wordGroup: pledge of allegiance 效忠誓言

sentences.en: Barons had to swear an oath of allegiance to the king.
Every morning the kids say the Pledge of Allegiance in unison.
sentences.cn: 每天早晨孩子们齐声进行效忠宣誓。

sentences.en: Most historians have underestimated the extent and significance of women's political allegiance in the antebellum period.
sentences.cn: 大多数历史学家低估了战前妇女政治忠诚的程度和重要性。
